data.text: A man who wishes to separate from friends seeks excuses;
A senseless man feels no need of wisdom,
When an ungodly man comes into a depth of evils, he despises them;
A word in the heart of a man is a deep water,
It is not good to accept the person of the ungodly,
The lips of a fool bring him into troubles,
A fool’s mouth is ruin to him,
Fear casts down the slothful;
A man who helps not himself by his labor
The name of the Lord is of great strength;
The wealth of a rich man is a strong city;
Before ruin a man’s heart is exalted,
Whoso answers a word before he hears a cause,
A wise servant calms a man’s anger;
The heart of the sensible man purchases discretion;
A man’s gift enlarges him,
A righteous man accuses himself at the beginning of his speech,
A silent man quells strifes,
A brother helped by a brother is as a strong and high city;
A man fills his belly with the fruits of his mouth;
Life and death are in the power of the tongue;
He that has found a good wife has found favors,
He that puts away a good wife, puts away a good thing,
